statement:
[**Theorem 1 -**]{} Let $(X,\| \cdot \|)$ be a normed vector space. $X$
is a Banach space if and only if every absolutely convergent series in
$X$ is convergent, i.e., whenever $\sum_n \|x_n\| < \infty,$
$\sum_n x_n$ converges in $X$.

[**Theorem 2 -**]{} Let $X, Y$ be normed vector spaces, $X \ne 0$. Let
$B(X,Y)$ be the space of bounded operators $X \longrightarrow Y$. Then
$Y$ is a Banach space if and only if $B(X,Y)$ is a Banach space.
names: necessary and sufficient conditions for a normed vector space to be a Banach space
